title: Centralized Security and SSO with MarkLogic
abstract: Steven Brockman and Thomas Diepenbrock of MarkLogic discuss an approach to protect one or more MarkLogic Applications with a SSO server and a reverse proxy. Security is enforced by mutual authentication along with an external Web Service call to look up user credentials (attributes and/or role) information. The user’s credentials are then applied during the lifetime of the user’s session. This basically achieves RBAC and ABAC. The ABAC features take advantage of MarkLogic’s dynamic role provisioning and compartment security features. This talk includes a demonstration of one such solution.

surveys.comments: Good examples of how dynamic role provisioning works in XQuery. Code samples were helpful.
